candidates.title: Qemu arm launcher
candidates.body: Providing a fuzzer crate for the arm qemu linux usermode based on the qemu_launcher fuzzer.

candidates.title: Cleanup duplicate package warnings
candidates.body:
Cargo spits out a bunch of `duplicate package` warnings when scanning the repo checkout of `libafl = { git = "..." }` for `Cargo.toml`s:

```
warning: skipping duplicate package `baby_fuzzer` found at `~/.cargo/git/checkouts/libafl-c33dc6f5ec2f7a70/c45b6be/fuzzers/baby_fuzzer_nautilus`
warning: skipping duplicate package `fuzzbench` found at `~/.cargo/git/checkouts/libafl-c33dc6f5ec2f7a70/c45b6be/fuzzers/fuzzbench_text`
[...]
```

candidates.title: TUI monitor breaks the terminal if main thread panics
candidates.body:
Using the TuiMonitor instead of the SimpleMonitor in the baby_fuzzer breaks the terminal in which the fuzzer runs as soon as the main thread panics and thus kills all threads.

Reproduce:
- Ubuntu 20.04
- GNOME Terminal
- Replace SimpleMonitor by TuiMonitor (see changes to `fuzzer/baby_fuzzer/src/main.rs`)
- Run fuzzer

Minor:
- Check clients != 0 in tui to avoid sub_overflow

candidates.title: Bump rand version, dropping support for lain
New hooks for libafl_qemu
candidates.body: The new hook system will allow multiple generation hooks (translation time). This will open the window to generation hooks that analyze the code and insert generic hooks to single instruction, for instance for call stack tracking.

candidates.title: Drop the build_id depedency and move to bolts
FeedbackState as metadata
candidates.body: experimental PR to have generic metadata and so allow to have feedback states as meta

candidates.title: Backtrace in libafl::Error
candidates.body:
#571 

errors_backtrace is the feature to use it, disabled by default

candidates.title: Sender id fix
candidates.body:
After the first restart, the sender was no longer set.
This PR re-reads the correct sender from the initialized page.
The sender data is now redundant in an env and the page, I guess this could be cleaned up further in the future.

repo.name: LibAFL
repo.description: Advanced Fuzzing Library - Slot your Fuzzer together in Rust! Scales across cores and machines. For Windows, Android, MacOS, Linux, no_std, ...
